result.execSummary:
The defendant Brittney N Johnes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge
Bond to be applied to restitution first then balance will be applied to fines and costs. 
Payment plan for balance due: $50.00/month commencing on March 1, 2017
Restitution will be paid out to victim by Clerk of Courts

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brittney N Johnes

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Marquette County DNA Proof of Submission

Defendant Brittney N Johnes in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee states plea agreement.  Atty Gumz agrees.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees and enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty.

  State has complied with victim notification requirements and files the victim impact statement with the court.
Atty Gumz makes sentencing arguments.

BY THE COURT:  Pay fine and costs = $379.00
DNA Sample + $200.00 Surcharge
Restitution = $84.21 + $8.42 = $92.63

Bond to be applied to restitution first and paid out to the victim and then apply balance to fine and costs.

  Defendant agrees to the $15.00 payment plan fee.
Payment Plan for Balance Due:  $50.00/month commencing on March 1, 2017
from Atty Hendee to reset JT set for January 12, 2017; officer not availabe.   Ok'd by Judge.

Final pre-trial on January 6, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial on February 9, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Final pre-trial on December 2, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial on January 12, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Mark Jay Gumz in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Gumz states that he has spoke with is client today and the matter is not resolved; requests trial.

BY THE COURT:  Set for Jury Trial
bond continued.  Jury trial scheduled for January 12, 2017 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for December 2, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Return date on September 21, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Mark Jay Gumz in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that an offer was provided.  Atty Gumz states that this is his first appearance on the matter and asks for a little more time to go over the offer.

BY THE COURT:  Reset.
bond continued.  Return date scheduled for September 21, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Return date on August 3, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Brittney N Johnes in court, in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court confirms defendant's address.  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney. Defendant understands.  Court finds probable cause to support the charges.

  BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.

Court questions the defendant.  Defendant contacted the PD office.
BY THE COURT:  Set for Return.
bond continued.  Return date scheduled for August 3, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

(attempted to notify victimis of right)
